title: Blest Hour When Mortal Man Retires
author: John Pierpont

verses.text:
Blest hour when mortal man retires
To hold communion with his God,
When earth-born passion he suspires
And leaves the world for prayer's abode.

Blest hour when, weary of his load
Of guilt and sorrow here below,
The Christian seeks his Father's abode,
And finds relief from every woe.

Blest hour when God inclines His ear
To mortal man's imploring cry,
Dispels the gloom of doubt and fear,
And bids the mourning spirit fly.

Then is the time the soul can feel
Its God is ever drawing nigh,
Then broken hearts begin to heal,
And tears of sorrow cease to flow.
